title: [UI] Tags error with non plaso data

labels.name: Medium effort
labels.description: Stuff that takes between 1d to a week to implement

milestone.title: Q2
milestone.description:
issues / PRs for this milestone should only be critical bugs that are related or caused by the change to make material design the default.

New feature Requests will go into `Q3` Milestone, or even the `future` milestone

body:
**Describe the bug**
Timelines that are not imported/processed via plaso don't have a tags attribute by default. When trying to add a tag in the new UI (e.g. quick tags) to such an event, it will throw an error since the attribute does not exists yet in the event.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Import data that is not generated by plaso.
2. Try to add a tag there.
3. See error

**Expected behavior**
With the new UI we changed the way tags work from database (ex labels) & attributes (tags) to attributes in the event only. The expected behaviour is, for the tagging feature to add an `tag` attribute if it does not exist yet.

title: UI: Analyzer Result searches on the wrong field
body:
**Describe the bug**
When there are more than 10 different analyzers run, the Analyzer Result section in the left panel will display a search bar for better navigation. However, the search is based on the `analyzer_name` key and not on the `analyzer_display_name` value which is the value visible to the user.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run > 10 different analyzers, including the `Windows logon/logoff events` analyzer
2. When the search bar shows up, search for `Windows` 
3. This will not result in `Windows logon/logoff events` showing up, since the analyzer_name is `login`.
4. Search for `login` and `Windows logon/logoff events` will show up.

**Expected behavior**
1. The search should be based on the display_name that is visible to the user.
2. (optional) It would be great if the search would also work for timeline names.

title: Timestamp is not added if missing despite datetime being present
body:
For CSV imports: Timestamp is not added if missing, despite datetime being present. This was recently removed in an effort to detect faulty timestamps in input data (#2586).

There needs to be both a datetime and timestamp field for the system to function.

Further more: The check for timestamp is not taking precision into account. Timestamps need to be compared on the same granularity (e.g. second).

title: [frontend-ng] timestamp_desc missing from list of mandatory headers in upload form
body:
**Describe the bug**
timestamp_desc is a mandatory header for a CSV/JSON upload but is missing from the list of mandatory headers in UploadForm.vue. If a user uploads a file without a timestamp_desc field, they will not have the opportunity to map the field in the UI. 

Offending code:

https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/feae441954926ea5db65fc5c78b607db7eaab0b7/timesketch/frontend-ng/src/components/UploadForm.vue#L182-L185

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Upload a CSV file without a timestamp_desc field
2. You won't be prompted to map the field
3. The file will upload successfully but fail processing because of the missing timestamp_desc header

**Expected behavior**
The user has the opportunity to map the timestamp_desc header like the other mandatory headers in the upload form

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
N/A

**Additional context**
N/A

title: Timeline deeplink in the new UI
body:
**Describe the bug**
The timeline deeplink from the old UI does not work with the new UI. This is especially problematic if we want to make the switch to the new UI as default at some point.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to `http://127.0.0.1:5000/sketch/1/explore?timeline=1`
2. Change the port to get the same page in the new UI: `http://127.0.0.1:5001/sketch/1/explore?timeline=1`
3. In the old UI the linked timeline will be selected. In the new UI the parameter is ignored and all timelines are selected. This will break links in case documentation etc.

**Expected behavior**
The timeline deeplink should selected the linked timeline in the new UI similar to how it is done in the old UI.

title: API Client not working with SelfSigned SSL certificates
body:
**Describe the bug**
When trying to connect to a Timesketch instance running with HTTPS and a SelfSigned certificate, the API client is not able to connect to the instance, even when setting the `verify` parameter in the config file to `True`.
This is due to the parameter being read from the config as `string`, but being used as `bool`. This leads to the API client always enforcing SSL verification.
I will add a PR in a minute, that will propse a fix for this.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run a Timesketch instance with a SelfSigned certificate
2. Run `ts_client = config.get_client()` and enter your settings interactively
3. Either set the `verify` parameter to `False` using the API or by directly editing `~/.timesketchrc`
4. Run `ts_client = config.get_client()`  again, forcing the client to reload its config from file
5. The client will still prompt `Unable to connect to the Timesketch server, are you connected to the network? Is the timesketch server running and accessible from your host? The error message is Timesketch server unreachable`

**Expected behavior**
When setting the `verify` parameter to `False`, a connection to a Timesketch instance running with SelfSigned certificates should be possible and SSL verification should not be enforced.

**Screenshots**
Not applicable here.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
Not applicable here.

**Additional context**
Not applicable here.

title: Frontend-ng csv importer parses time wrong

labels.name: Data import
labels.description: All things that are with importing data

body:
**Describe the bug**
Importing a csv seems to miss a lot of accuracy of datetime.
E.g. this line:
```
2022-11-10T05-07-28+00:00,78Vh3h7,1668056848119860,Time Logged
```

Becomes: 

```
{
   "__ts_timeline_id": 17,
   "datetime": "2022-11-10T05:00:00+00:00",
   "message": "78Vh3h7",
   "timestamp": 1668056400000000,
   "timestamp_desc": "Time Logged"
}
```

Which clearly is wrong

**Expected behavior**
Datetime should be correct

title: Nginx proxy_read_timeout
body:
**Describe the bug**
Nginx wait 60s by defaut to get return of "proxified request",  some requets can take long time.
http://nginx.org/en/docs/http/ngx_http_proxy_module.html#proxy_read_timeout

**To Reproduce**
Example: The PR https://github.com/google/timesketch/pull/2077 can use requests on opensearch and can take more of 60s in some case.

**Expected behavior**
Some queries may take longer than 60 seconds.
Can you add "proxy_read_timeout" in nginx.conf to change defaut time.

title: Unable to publish Timesketch on a non-standard port
body:
**Describe the bug**
When presenting Timesketch on a non-standard port (through NAT port forwarding or editing the Docker file to publish a different port), any requests to Timesketch result in the browser redirecting back to the default port. This is due to the nginx $host environment variable not including the port number.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Edit the docker-compose.yml file to expose Timesketch on port 8080 ("8080:80")
2. docker-compose up
3. Browse to localhost:8080
4. The browser redirects to https://localhost/login?next=%2F

GET http://localhost:9080/
302 Redirect > http://localhost/login/?next=%2F

**Expected behavior**
The redirection should include the non-standard port
i.e. http://localhost:9080/login?next=%2F

**To Fix**
Edit nginx.conf to update "proxy_set_header Host $host" to "proxy_set_header Host $http_host"
$http_host includes the port number when connecting to a non-standard port.

**Additional context**
For more information about this problem with other applications, see https://serverfault.com/a/916736

title: Migrate OOB flow to localhost flow for OAuth2 authentication
body:
**Describe the bug**
Google deprecated the OOB Oauth2 flow. The Timesketch API client needs to start using the localhost http server flow to authenticate via OAuth2.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Clear cached credentials
2. Attempt to use the command-line timesketch cli client and authenticate via Google OAuth2

**Expected behavior**
Authentication should be successful.

title: Add manual event
body:
# Add a manual event in Timesketch V2

This PR is the continuation of PR #2304: it solves the issue of creating a new manual event correlated to an existing timeline event at the bottom of the page.

In the previous version, the pop-up to insert a manual event was always displayed at the top of the page. To this end, if the user wanted to insert a manual event correlated to an event at the bottom of the page, then the pop-up was not shown on the screen. In the next figure, by clicking on the selected button, the pop-up to insert a manual event is not shown on the screen because it is created at the top of the page.

![Screenshot 2022-09-09 11 07 16 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108743205/189314695-dc1b0cf1-0738-4ec5-b6df-9596f9977615.png)


We cope with this limitation by opening a dialog page instead of a pop-up at the top of the page: in this way the user can always watch the dialog window independently from the selected event.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108743205/189314977-018814f7-92e3-4c82-97a7-1ac0f4fddda6.png)

title: Export Sketch feature returns HTTP 500 error
body:
**Describe the bug**
When attempting to export a Sketch the backend responds with a HTTP 500 Error

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Open any sketch
2. Click on 'More' in the top menu then click on 'Export'
3. Open the developers tools in Chrome browser and the error will be there. 

**Expected behavior**
A zip file with all the timelines in the Sketch downloaded to your machine.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Mac 
 - Browser Chrome
 - Version 104

title: Uploads not working with newest Plaso
body:
**Describe the bug**
When trying to upload a plaso file (I used the test plaso file in this case), the upload fails with `psort.py: error: unrecognized arguments: --elastic_user opensearch --elastic_password opensearch`

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to an investigation
2. Click on upload timeline
3. Wait for it to finish uploading
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
The file should upload and index correctly

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Mac
 - Browser Chrome
 - Version 104.0.5112.101

**Additional context**
I believe the fix here is to change the arguments being passed into `psort.py`. The `elastic_user` argument [here](https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/843e046b57c4bf3f47400c778f8fbddf5a7e8eb5/timesketch/lib/tasks.py#L661) should be `opensearch_user` and the `elastic_password` [here](https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/843e046b57c4bf3f47400c778f8fbddf5a7e8eb5/timesketch/lib/tasks.py#L665) should be `opensearch_password`

title: Redirect URL is missing after OIDC authn
body:
**Describe the bug**
Redirect URL is missing after OIDC authn. The URL parameter is lost when the redirect happen. The solution is to store the parameter in the session, and redirect after the OIDC has been verified (state with CSRF token etc).

title: Issue indexing plaso files after uploading
body:
**Describe the bug**
When uploading a plaso file to timesketch via timesketch-importer or through the GUI, we receive the error: 

```
usage: psort.py [-h] [--troubles] [-V] [--analysis PLUGIN_LIST]
                [--process_memory_limit SIZE]
                [--temporary_directory DIRECTORY] [--worker_memory_limit SIZE]
                [--worker_timeout MINUTES] [--logfile FILENAME] [-d] [-q] [-u]
                [--status_view TYPE] [--slice DATE_TIME]
                [--slice_size SLICE_SIZE] [--slicer] [--data PATH] [-a]
                [--language LANGUAGE_TAG] [--dynamic_time]
                [--output_time_zone TIME_ZONE] [-o FORMAT] [-w OUTPUT_FILE]
                [--profilers PROFILERS_LIST] [--profiling_directory DIRECTORY]
                [--profiling_sample_rate SAMPLE_RATE]
                [PATH] [FILTER]
psort.py: error: unrecognized arguments: --server opensearch --port 9200 --index_name 5a96c741d01b401abe20514183df1645 --elastic_mappings /etc/timesketch/plaso.mappings --timeline_identifier 10

```
**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

title: Submission of a CSV file with malformed headers creates infinite loop of HTTP requests
body:
**Bug Description**
The submission of a CSV with missing mandatory headers fals on the server side. However, even if the clients are notified with an error, they will try to retrieve the timeline using the HTTP requests `/api/v1/sketch/sketch_ID` and `/api/v1/sketch/sketch_ID/timeline/timeline_ID`. These requests are sent until the uploaded CSV file is manually deleted. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to Timesketch (TS) UI and submit a CSV file that is not compliant with TS specifications (e.g., missing headers).
2. Refresh the page and verify on the info tab of the submission that you have received the error: `Missing fields in CSV header: datetime,timestamp_desc`
3. Open the network tab on your window and verify that your Browser is sending HTTP requests to retrieve the non-created-timeline, thus it will send indefinitely HTTP requests. 

**Expected behavior**
When a CSV file is sent to the Server and some constraints are missed (e.g., mandatory headers are not present), then the Server should return an error that prevents the client to retrieve a non-existing resources

**Screenshots**
The image below shows the error message that the clients receive when they submit a CSV with wrong headers.
 
![errorMessageTS](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108743205/179936232-3091bc7e-52b0-4132-a499-3890f8f0728d.png)

The image below shows the HTTP requests after that the user  submits the CSV and after he receives the error message. In a correct scenario, i.e., when the CSV is correctly formatted, these HTTP requests are used to check the status of the uploading of the CSV file into Opensearch.

![infiniteHTTPReq](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108743205/179937085-97ef7602-dcda-4e3a-958a-334b43484724.png)


**Additional context**
UI_2237 should partially solve this problem since CSV files with missing mandatory headers can not be uploaded using the UI.

title: gcs-importer fails to read username when importing Plaso db from GCS

labels.name: Data import

body:
**Describe the bug**
When the gcs-importer attempts to import a plaso file from GCS, it fails to read the username from the "requester" field in the .plaso.metadata.json file. This means the import fails.

Jul 14 07:51:58 timesketch-server python3[14864]: 2022-07-14 07:51:58,892 [INFO] Downloaded file from GCS: /tmp/381929d791d04ec0a12f85454cf08196.plaso.metadata.json

Jul 14 07:51:59 timesketch-server python3[14864]: 2022-07-14 07:51:59 INFO     Downloaded file from GCS: /tmp/381929d791d04ec0a12f85454cf08196.plaso
Jul 14 07:51:59 timesketch-server python3[14864]: 2022-07-14 07:51:59,926 [ERROR] Missing username
Jul 14 07:51:59 timesketch-server python3[14864]: 2022-07-14 07:51:59 ERROR    Missing username

Since [this commit](https://github.com/google/turbinia/commit/125696c8c6bd784af435316a020a38fd608dd5e5) in Turbinia, the "requester" field is under "globals" in the .plaso.metadata.json file, while Timesketch attempts to [read it directly from the root level](https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/e33056e17a10e961dcd4b897c2cd66a1fc12ebae/contrib/gcs_importer.py#L171)

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Install latest Turbinia
2. Install latest Timesketch
3. Set up GCS importer
4. Analyze something with Turbinia and have it drop results to GCS
5. Observe GCS importer fail.

**Expected behavior**
The plaso database is correctly imported and indexed. 

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]
 - Version [e.g. 22]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: `ReferenceError: SVG is not defined` when running unittests.
body:
**Describe the bug**
Unit tests for the frontend involving certain components can't be run because of the following 

**To Reproduce**
Try adding a unit test file in `timesketch/frontend/tests/` that imports `ExplorePreview.vue`, e.g.

```js
import { expect } from 'chai'
import { shallowMount } from '@vue/test-utils'

import Intelligence from '@/views/Intelligence' // ExplorePreview is an indirect dependency of this.

describe('Intelligence.vue', () => {
  it('should correctly do something', () => {
    let wrapper = shallowMount(Intelligence, {})
    expect(wrapper.findAll('.container p.card-header-title').at(0).text()).toBe('Indicators of compromise')
  })
})
```

```
docker-compose exec timesketch yarn run --cwd=/usr/local/src/timesketch/timesketch/frontend test:unit

title: Unit test test_invalid_algorithm_raises_jwt_validation_error failing in PPA tests
body:
GitHub Action unit-tests is failing test test_invalid_algorithm_raises_jwt_validation_error  with a `jwt.exceptions.InvalidKeyError` in the PPA environment. Example run: https://github.com/google/timesketch/runs/7293421964?check_suite_focus=true

This unit test encodes an invalid JWT and then asserts that decoding fails but it looks like newer versions of PyJWT will raise an exception on attempts to encode an invalid JWT in the first place.

Not sure why the test environment is including a newer version of PyJWT. The `python3-jwt` package seems to still be at 1.7.1 https://packages.ubuntu.com/focal/python3-jwt.

title: sigma_rule_status.csv appears to be missing in containers after contrib/deploy_timesketch.sh install script
body: **Describe the bug** After installing timesketch via the Script and starting the docker-containers a 404 error is raised after every request. **To Reproduce** Steps to reproduce the behavior: 1. Execute the script 2. Open the website 3. Create a new investigation **Expected behavior** An investigation is created without the 404 error. **Screenshots** Error Message: **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - Ubuntu 20.04.4 LTS Kernel: Linux 5.4.0-117-generic Architecture: x86-64 - Browser: Firefox **Additional context** To fix it I downloaded sigma_rule_status.csv from this git and manually added it to the etc/timesketch/ folder. After this everything worked as expected. I assume it is for some reason not copied by default anymore but I do not understand the structure of the project well enough to know for certain.

title: New authentication cannot be performed on terminals with no tty
body:
**Describe the bug**
When authenticating for the first time (or after removing a token) the user is presented with a url to visit via stdout, and a token is entered via stdin. In a session with no, or non default tty's, this means the user will not see the url, and may not be able to enter the token.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set up an environment with no standard tty. An example is timesketch api user [DFTimewolf](https://github.com/log2timeline/dftimewolf), which has recently implemented a curses UX. 
2. Remove your timesketch token from `~/.timesketch.token`
3. Run the tool

**Expected behavior**
The user should be notified that the session won't support providing a URL to visit, and cannot accept the required token

**Actual behavior**
The user is not aware they need to reauthenticate, as stdout is not available. A user cannot paste the authentication token into the terminal as stdin is not available. Instead, the application blocks on stdin with no indication of the problem.

title: Sigma_util: Expected 5 fields in line , saw 9
body:
Seems when Sigma in TS finds a rule that has problems and wants to add a newline to the status csv, it does not add a newline. That results in a csv with one line having 9 fields instead of 5 causing exceptions.

Solution should be simple to add a newline at the beginning

title: Intelligence not escaping certain characters correctly
body:
Marking a path that value is:

`C:\Documents and Settings\dfir`
Will create the following intel entry:

`"C:\Documents and Settings\dfir"`
But should be:

`"C:\\Documents\ and\ Settings\\dfir"`

title: timesketch.api.sigma/ERROR OS Error, unable to get the path to the Sigma rules.

title: tsctl - No such command 'add_user'
body:
Installing Timesketch via the docs on a new Ubuntu VM and running 
```
sudo docker-compose exec timesketch-web tsctl add_user --username <username>
```

threw an error:
```
Usage: tsctl [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...
Try 'tsctl --help' for help.

Error: No such command 'add_user'.
```

The command that worked was 
```
sudo docker-compose exec timesketch-web tsctl create-user <username>
```
Proposing changes to the installation documentation to reflect - Pull Request #2160 

tsctl usage:
```
:/opt/timesketch$ sudo docker-compose exec timesketch-web tsctl --help
Usage: tsctl [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

  Management script for the Timesketch application.

Options:
  --version  Show the flask version
  --help     Show this message and exit.

Commands:
  add-group-member     Add a user to a group.
  create-group         Create a group.
  create-user          Create a user.
  db                   Perform database migrations.
  disable-user         Disable a user.
  drop-db              Drop all database tables.
  enable-user          Enable a user.
  grant-user           Grant access to a sketch.
  list-group-members   List all members of a group.
  list-groups          List all groups.
  list-sketches        List all sketches.
  list-users           List all users.
  make-admin           Give a user the admin role.

  run                  Run a development server.
  shell                Run a shell in the app context.
  version              Return the version information of Timesketch.
```

title: PLASO_UPPER_MEMORY_LIMIT value of 0 is ignored when running psort.py
body:
**Describe the bug**
If PLASO_UPPER_MEMORY_LIMIT is set to 0, Timesketch does not pass this value through to the --process_memory_limit flag when running psort.py even though 0 is a valid process_memory_limit value for psort.py. Setting the process_memory_limit to 0 on psort.py disables the limit, which is useful in Timesketch when troubleshooting memory issues or processing very large Plaso files. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set PLASO_UPPER_MEMORY_LIMIT to 0 in timesketch.conf
2. Upload a really large timeline that will need more than 4 GB of memory to process
3. Get MemoryError from Plaso when you hit the default 4 GB memory limit

**Expected behavior**
Setting PLASO_UPPER_MEMORY_LIMIT should cause --process_memory_limit to be set to 0 when psort.py is run.

**Screenshots**
N/A

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
N/A

**Additional context**
N/A

title: Incorrect permissions on directory data/opensearch
body:
**Describe the bug**
The permissions on directory `data/opensearch` are `root:root 0755` by default. Opensearch in the opensearch container will fail if it cannot write to this directory, which as user `1000` it cannot do.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behaviour:
1. Follow instructions at https://timesketch.org/guides/admin/install/ to start the containers
2. Create a sketch, navigate to sketch page
3. Observe `Internal Server Error`. 

I verified by listing listening ports inside the container. On timesketch host: 
```
$ docker exec -u root -it opensearch /bin/bash
bash-4.2# cat /proc/net/tcp
  sl  local_address rem_address   st tx_queue rx_queue tr tm->when retrnsmt   uid  timeout inode
   0: 00000000:25B2 00000000:0000 0A <snip>
   1: 0B00007F:A859 00000000:0000 0A <snip> 
   2: 00000000:2580 00000000:0000 0A <snip>
```

(Those ports need to be converted from hex, but 9200 is not listed)

**Expected behaviour**
Opensearch starts and is listening on port 9200.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS
 - Browser Firefox
 - Version 91.4.1esr (64-bit)

Adding `chown 1000 timesketch/data/opensearch` to the deploy script fixed the issue for me. PR with the same incoming.

title: Wrong OPENSEARCH_HOST preset in timesketch.conf
body:
**Describe the bug**
After a fresh install I was not able to acces a new sketch.

It ended up in backtrace error messages in /opt/timesketch/logs/wsgi_error.log.


[2022-01-07 13:16:15 +0000] [14] [ERROR] Error handling request /api/v1/sketches/1/
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/connection.py", line 159, in _new_conn
    conn = connection.create_connection(
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/util/connection.py", line 84, in create_connection
    raise err
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/urllib3/util/connection.py", line 74, in create_connection
    sock.connect(sa)
ConnectionRefusedError: [Errno 111] Connection refused

followed by several other backtrace connection error messages.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:

1. Go to (https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/master/docs/guides/admin/install.md)
2. Follow instruction and install timesketch
3. Start timesketch
4. Access timesketch by webbrowser and logon
5. Create new sketch
6. Try to access new sketch.
7. See log message in wsgi_error.log

**Expected behavior**
After creation of a new sketch it should be accessable in the webbrowser.


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS
 - Browser firefox 
 - Docker 20.10.7, build 20.10.7-oubuntu5-20.04.2

**Additional context**
I was able to locate and fix the bug.

My timesketch installation was located in

/opt/timesketch

The configuration file

/opt/timesketch/etc/timesketch/timesketch.conf 

contains the entries for opensearch as followed:


OPENSEARCH_HOST = '127.0.0.1'
OPENSEARCH_PORT = 9200
OPENSEARCH_USER = None
OPENSEARCH_PASSWORD = None
OPENSEARCH_SSL = False
OPENSEARCH_VERIFY_CERTS = True
OPENSEARCH_TIMEOUT = 10


After changing the value of OPENSEARCH_HOST like this

OPENSEARCH_HOST = 'opensearch'

the connection error didn't occure any more.

I think the problem was that the preset value of OPENSEARCH_HOST didn't match the docker opensearch containers hostname.

title: docker-compose up failing due to elasticsearch reference

WARNING: The ELASTIC_VERSION variable is not set. Defaulting to a blank string.

title: Sketch attributes deleted via the API cannot be re-added by an analyzer
body:
**Describe the bug**
Deleting a sketch attribute via the notebook will prevent it from being re-added by an analyzer run.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior (using the dev container):
1. Add `self.sketch.add_sketch_attribute('test123', ['test'], 'text')` to an analyzer's `run` method.
2. Run the analyzer and confirm attribute has been added via the TimeSketch UI.
3. Using the notebook runtime on port 8844 initialise the sketch object and then run the following code to remove all sketch attributes:
```
for attribute in sketch.attributes:
    sketch.remove_attribute(attribute, 'text')
```
4. Re run the same analyzer and the attribute will not be re-added.

**Expected behavior**
Once the attribute has been deleted running the analyzer should re-create the sketch attribute.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - Running the dev Docker setup, doesn't appear to be related to Browser/OS environment.

**Additional context**
In https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/master/timesketch/lib/analyzers/interface.py#L467
```
467        attribute = Attribute.query.filter_by(name=name).first()
```
Is still returning an instance of `timesketch.models.sketch.Attribute` for an attribute that has been deleted via the notebook but will return `None` for an attribute that has never been created.

This seems to suggest an issue at the SQLAlchemy layer.

Example: The number of events in the Sketch are listed as Zero but the many events and timelines in the Sketch. **To Reproduce** The data was loaded with the following commands. ``` log2timeline.py --parsers 'mactime' --hashers md5 --status_view window --storage_file /cases/528/plaso/sam-adragoon-l.plaso /cases/528/mft/sam-adragoon-l.body log2timeline.py --parsers '!mft,!usnjrnl,!filestat' --hashers md5 --status_view window --storage_file /cases/528/plaso/sam-adragoon-l.plaso cases/528/collect/sam-adragoon-l/C # for my load verification - not part of the actual load to Timesketch. psort.py --output-time-zone 'UTC' -o l2tcsv -w /cases/528/psort/sam-adragoon-l.csv /cases/528/plaso/sam-adragoon-l.plaso # for my load verification - not part of the actual load to Timesketch. pinfo.py -w /cases/528/pinfo/sam-adragoon-l.pinfo /cases/528/plaso/sam-adragoon-l.plaso timesketch_importer -u sansforensics -p forensics --host http://127.0.0.1 --index_name sam-sam-adragoon-l --sketch_id 1 --timeline_name sam-sam-adragoon-l /cases/528/plaso/sam-adragoon-l.plaso ``` **Expected behavior** I would expect that the stats are updated with the total number of events loaded. The sum of the events for each timeline in the sketch. **Screenshots** **Desktop (please complete the following information):** - Ubuntu 20.04 - I'm running Timesketch as a Docker container. - Plaso (version 20211024) is installed locally. - timesketch_importer --version - API Client Version: 20210602 - Importer Client Version: 20210602 - I don't know how to get the Timesketch version. Docker is using the :latest tag and I could not trace that back. **Additional context** The Timesketch UI looks different that the last version. I have noted some of those item in the screenshots provided.

title: Customized columns are not populated
body:

When you add additional columns in the explore view the columns are not filled with the data of entries.

**To Reproduce**

title: Some components are incompatible with node 10.
body:
**Describe the bug**
Yarn install fails on a fresh ubuntu 20.04 install, or even a Docker container

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior: https://github.com/google/timesketch/runs/4167754674?check_suite_focus=true

**Potential solution**
Upgrade to node 12 in the dockerfile: https://www.digitalocean.com/community/tutorials/how-to-install-node-js-on-ubuntu-20-04

**Additional context**
This seems to happen on a fresh install when doing `yarn run` or `yarn install`

title: Expand "Data Types" overview counts

milestone.description: All stuff that will happen in H2 of 2021

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I really like the "Data Types" summary view with the count of each record. However, it only shows the top 10 data types, and it took me a while to realize those weren't the only data types in the sketch. Just showing the top ones is fine, but the problem was I didn't realize there were more than that.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Somehow indicate that it's the top 10 data types (either change the title to something like "Top Data Types", or add at the bottom something like "+ 6 more data types". Basically some indicator that this isn't **all** the data types in the sketch.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4984680/137220983-8a7d5b21-7706-4a34-b70d-fa50ea7e7fce.png)

title: currentSearchNode state not getting set in store.js
body:
**Describe the bug**
This issue occurs due to unknown reason. what happens is that multiple functions such as the toggle start and browsing search history are suddenly stop working (most probably due to having a lot of search history activities).
below are the web console logs:
Event generated after first Access to sketch:
```
TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'id')
    at o.isSelected (SearchHistoryTreeNode.vue:55)
    at ni.get (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:28705)
    at ni.evaluate (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:28810)
    at o.isSelected (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:29008)
    at o.xs (SearchHistoryTreeNode.vue?dd77:1)
    at o.t._render (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:27861)
    at o.i (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:28319)
    at ni.get (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:28705)
    at new ni (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:28694)
    at jn (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:28326)
```
Toggle Start:
```
TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'id')
    at Object.saveEventAnnotation (RestApiClient.js:158)
    at o.toggleStar (EventListRow.vue:357)
    at ne (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:26344)
    at HTMLSpanElement.n (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:26567)
    at HTMLSpanElement.Jr.a._wrapper (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:30988)
```
Search history:
```
TypeError: Cannot read properties of null (reading 'id')
    at o.<anonymous> (SearchHistoryTree.vue:89)
    at Array.<anonymous> (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:26468)
    at ue (chunk-vendors.a6947d36.js:26394)
```
all of these function share the same issue which is having the value null for the attribute id. I took a look on what might have been going on and it seems for some reason in [store.js](https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/b45d1dbf73e7244eaf1a096f941fa9e4b23b0329/timesketch/frontend/src/store.js) the [SET_COUNT](https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/b45d1dbf73e7244eaf1a096f941fa9e4b23b0329/timesketch/frontend/src/store.js#L56) and [SET_SEARCH_NODE ](https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/b45d1dbf73e7244eaf1a096f941fa9e4b23b0329/timesketch/frontend/src/store.js#L59)functions are not getting initialized so the default value null is set for currentSearchNode. Moreover in another sketch with less data the above functions work as intended. so over all i think there is some sort of  timeout due to the payload attribute size.

title: Properly parse file extensions on web uploads
body:
**Describe the bug**
There is a bug in timesketch/frontend/src/components/Common/UploadForm.vue on line 126 when grabbing the fileExtension. If the file name has multiple '.' in it, the code will not pull the correct file extension as it's searching for the first item after a period. This won't always be the last item in the split. Plaso currently outputs a filename like plaso.name.name2.plaso. If you try to upload this plaso file you will get an extension error. The code should be [-1] instead of [1]. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Try to upload a plaso file that has multiple periods in the file name such as: plaso.computername.domain.com.plaso.

**Expected behavior**
The file extension should be pulled from the end of the filename. Not the first item after splitting on the periods.

**Screenshots**
Not applicable.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: linux (any)
 - Browser any
 - Version latestt

**Additional context**
Creating a pull request to fix:

title: Timesketch doesn't understand when http_response_bytes is "-"
body:
**Describe the bug**
When you upload data from Plaso's `apache_access` parser, Timesketch complains and doesn't display log events that have `http_response_bytes` as "-". The following log line can be seen on the worker's log:

```
[400] <mapper_parsing_exception> failed to parse field [http_response_bytes] of type [long] in document with id 'xyz'. Preview of field's value: '-' [illegal_argument_exception/For input string: "-"]
```
[Apache's documentation](https://httpd.apache.org/docs/2.4/mod/mod_log_config.html#logformat) states that: "%b - Size of response in bytes, excluding HTTP headers. In CLF format, i.e. a '-' rather than a 0 when no bytes are sent.".

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Get Apache logs that have `http_response_bytes` as "-" (see [here](https://github.com/log2timeline/plaso/blob/5198673e2312eac0bbf35fb200cb8bfedea88423/test_data/access.log#L7))
2. Process with Plaso's `apache_access` parser
3. Upload to Timesketch
4. Observe events missing

**Expected behavior**
See all the events in Timesketch.

title: No indexed data available after ingesting 3.3GB plaso file

labels.name: Data import
labels.description: All things that are with importing data

body:
**Describe the bug**
Importing a 3.3GB plaso file through the web interface has resulted in just showing "Indexing in progress" under the investigation screen for over an hour. The Elasticsearch instance was taking a fair bit of CPU for a while, and document count was increasing, however now it is stopped and the data is still unavailable.
  
No data has shown up under the `/sketch/1/explore` interface. Monitoring the ES index I can see nothing else is being added.

```shell
Every 5.0s: curl http://127.0.0.1:9200/_cat/indices?v=true&s=index                                                                                                                                                        12536c45c0d4: Fri Sep  3 11:17:06 2021

health status index                            uuid                   pri rep docs.count docs.deleted store.size pri.store.size
yellow open   09881955a21b480d8a56a7c7e53c0774 eMnvRAfBSn6719c67NeP2g   1   1    5844839            0      1.6gb          1.6gb
```
**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Installed via the latest `deploy_timesketch.sh` script
2. `cd /opt/`
3. `~/timesketch_deploy.sh`
4. Created user
5. Created a plaso file with latest log2timeline/plaso docker image of a mounted volume
6. Uploaded to timesketch web interface

**Expected behavior**
Plaso file is parsed and data available.
If an upload, indexing, or other part of the process fails I would expect errors to bubble up to the client


**Additional context**
I've checked the `docker logs` of the containers and not spotted anything, but I'm unsure where to look.

title: SSH analyzer creates saved search and story even with 0 results
body:
The SSH analyzer will create a saved search even if there are no results from the analyzer.

Fix: Only create saved search if there was any sessions created.

title: Sigma analyzer creates saved search and story even with 0 results

milestone.description: All stuff that will happen in H2 of 2021

body:
The Sigma analyzer will create a story and saved search even if there are no results from the analyzer.

Fix: Only create saved search and story if there was any events tagged.

title: Error in Celery Worker message when skipping values
body:
**Describe the bug**

When uploading a timeline with "malformed datetime" values, the celery worker reports the following:

```
[2021-07-27 01:15:52,379] timesketch.utils/WARNING Rows 0 to 10000 skipped due to malformed datetime values
[2021-07-27 01:15:52,420] timesketch.utils/WARNING Rows 10000 to 10000 skipped due to malformed datetime values
```

**Expected behavior**

In this above output, I would expect the output to be "10000 to 20000".

Additionally, upon reviewing read_and_validate_csv() in utils.py - the function skips an entire chunk of timeline entries (default 10000).  In the worst case, for 1 malformed timestamp it would drop 9999 valid timeline entries which could contain pertinent evidence.

title: "My recent activity" shouldn't display clickable links to deleted sketches
body:
**Describe the bug**
The main page for Timesketch lists all the sketches and the section "My recent activity" shows recently visited sketches, even if they were deleted, which I think it should not be the case as clicking on those sketches leads to "an invalid URL" message.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a sketch that already exists
2. Delete the sketch
3. Go to the "My recent activity" section in the main Timesketch web page
4. Click on the deleted sketch and see an error

**Expected behavior**
I think either the links should be indicated as deleted (e.g. crossed out, not clickable and hover-over shows a tooltip that says the sketch was deleted) or it should not list the deleted sketches.

title: Internal Server Error on `sketch.generate_timeline_from_es_index`
body:
**Describe the bug**

The `sketch.generate_timeline_from_es_index` API Client method call sometimes fails with an Internal Server Error.

It is because the `update_by_query` ES request done by the API may timeout if there are lots of events to update.

title: Potential authentication bypass plaso ingestion via timesketch_importer
body:
**Describe the bug**
I was able to upload plaso files without any authentication using the following commands via timesketch_importer.

I used the latest TS docker version as per the https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/master/docs/getting-started/install.md guide.

**To Reproduce**

Scenario 1 - Valid user
--------------------
timesketch_importer -u jdoe --pwd-prompt --host http://127.0.0.1 --index_name plaso-dc --timeline_name dc --quick /home/dfir/dc.plaso

Scenario 2 - Invalid user
 timesketch_importer -u joe --pwd-prompt --host http://127.0.0.1 --index_name plaso-dc2 --timeline_name dc --quick /home/dfir/dc.plaso

Scenario 1 - Prompt for password

title: Wrong initial parameters get cached for forever
body:
**Describe the bug**
While doing first login through timesketch-importer cli tool, if the parameter related to authentication type is spelled wrongly, there seems to be no way to reset it back. TImesketch container saves whatever is passed to it.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Run timesketch_importer on a freshly deployed docker instance to upload a CSV file as follows- timesketch_importer somefile.csv

3.  The authentication fails. 
4. Every following attempt with all possible parameters doesn't change the exception message. Hosenstly I am new to timesketch and don't know if there exists a method to solve this.

title: Aggregation calender widget using browser time instead of UTC
body:
**Description**
In the aggregations screen, when selecting times for  the `ISO formatted timestamp for the start time of the aggregated data` and `ISO formatted end time for the aggregation` fields the UI give the user a calendar and time selection widget. The date and time for that calendar appear to be in my browser's timezone, rather than UTC time (see the image below). This means that the time I select then gets instantly converted into the UTC/ISO time for the field. This makes selecting start and end times a little more tricky since you will have to account for the timezone your browser is in. I get this behavior in both a locally installed Timesketch v20210507 and https://demo.timesketch.org/, as of May 13, 2021.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/69635449/118192231-d40e0900-b413-11eb-84ef-181bf29f6524.png)

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Ensure your web browser is set to time timezone other than UTC. My browser was set to EST5EDT (UTC-04).
2. Log into Timesketch v20210507 or https://demo.timesketch.org/
3. Go into a sketch, e.g Case of the stolen szechuan sauce.
4. Go to Aggregate 
5. Select all  timelines
6. Select Terms aggregations
7. Select a table chart to render
8. Select any field to aggregate on, e.g. parser
9. Click on the  `ISO formatted timestamp for the start time of the aggregated data`  field and in the calendar widget select 2020-09-19 03:22:00. If your browser was set to UTC-04 then the ISO time will be converted to 2020-09-19T07:22:00.
10. Click on the `ISO formatted end time for the aggregation` field and in the calendar widget select 2020-09-19 03:24:00. If your browser was set to UTC-04 then the ISO time will be converted to 2020-09-19T07:24:00.

**Expected Behavior**
The time selected in the calendar widget should be UTC time, meaning it will be the same as what eventually gets written to the start/end time fields.

**Desktop**
OS- this issue was observed on Windows 10 and Ubuntu 20.04 hosts
Browser- this issue was observed using Firefox on both Windows 10 and Ubuntu 20.04 hosts

title: Sigma rule |endswith potentially not match events (xml_string)

A rule, e.g.: https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma/blob/master/rules/windows/image_load/sysmon_susp_system_drawing_load.yml has a condition ```endswith```. For this fieldname, it is mapped to ```xml_string```where the value does not really end with it but rather is containing the value.

I am not sure at the moment how to fix that.

title: Detection date of elastic on jsonl/csv

labels.name: Data import
labels.description: All things that are with importing data

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
When upload jsonl, some field have date information, but the date format can be different on same field. If elsatic have 'detection_date = true" on index (it's default config) then upload timeline generate error:
```
[2021-04-29 11:07:53,471] timesketch.elasticsearch/ERROR Unable to 
upload document: u5BQHXkBHBT8NHjyT4RB to index 
1619694388.0804214spyre_pole_p3 - [400] <mapper_parsing_exception> 
failed to parse field [real_time] of type [date] in document with id 
'u5BQHXkBHBT8NHjyT4RB'. Preview of field's value: '2020-07-07 
15:49:51.7636847 +0200 CEST' [illegal_argument_exception/failed to parse 
date field [2020-07-07 15:49:51.7636847 +0200 CEST] with format 
[strict_date_optional_time||epoch_millis]]
```
The problem can be same on field change type. Example: field X have value "bla" and other line (jsonl) have value 2. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
My solution is create generic.mappings for jsonl index create. You can specify mappings for your case.

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
It's may be interesting to add option on API upload to choose 'mappings' exclusively for your timeline upload.

**Additional context**
I PR my proposal (generic.mappings).

Thanks
Lionel

title: Timestamp issues displaying in UX

labels.name: Medium effort
labels.description: Stuff that takes between 1d to a week to implement

body:
**Describe the bug**

Two issues were introduced in https://github.com/google/timesketch/commit/7fd82062a8ce031270a31bde8e8acaf10c0b5798:

* The `formatTimestamp` filter has a conversion bug for timestamps in seconds (`* 1000000` should be `* 1000` to convert seconds to milliseconds). This results in odd timestamps being displayed in the UI when using this timestamp format.
* The `timestamp` field is now used to display the Date & Time information but this field is not required (see https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/master/docs/learn/create-timeline-from-json-csv.md for the documented list of required fields)

I could probably do a PR to fix this but I'm not sure which way this should be fixed: revert back to using `datetime` or fix the helper and add `timestamp` to the required fields ?

title: Timesketch doesn't respect elasticsearch auth config
body:
**Describe the bug**
The elasticsearch authentication related configuration values are being ignored and therefore the queries result in an `AuthenticationException`.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Specify the elasticsearch auth fields in `timesketch.conf`: `ELASTIC_USER`, `ELASTIC_PASSWORD`
2. Try to create a new sketch or check an existing one, an `Internal Server Error` error message will pop up on the screen. Then in the logs the following exception will be reported: 
```bash
elasticsearch.exceptions.AuthenticationException: AuthenticationException(401, 'security_exception', 'missing authentication credentials for REST request [/_search?size=0]')
```

**Expected behavior**
Expected a successful authentication against the elasticsearch instance.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 20.04
 - Version: 20210224

**Additional context**
I've tested the elasticsearch side with a kibana instance. The security plugin that is being utilized is `xpack`.

```
  elasticsearch:
    environment:
      - TAKE_FILE_OWNERSHIP=1
      - discovery.type=single-node
      - "ES_JAVA_OPTS=-Xms2g -Xmx2g"
      - xpack.security.enabled=true
      - ELASTIC_PASSWORD=<my-es-password>
```

title: Suggest indenting the tips on the required fields for CSV/JSON

milestone.description: All stuff that will happen in H2 of 2021

body:
The https://timesketch.org/learn/create-timeline-from-json-csv/ documentation listed the required fields for CSV/JSON in a bulleted list but the list has no indentation/levels to distinguish between the required fields and the tips:
-     message
-     String with an informative message of the event
-     datetime
-     ISO8601 format
-     Ex: 2015-07-24T19:01:01+00:00
-     timestamp_desc
-     String explaining what type of timestamp it is. E.g file created
-     Ex: "Time created"


Suggesting adding indentation to avoid confusion:
-     message
       -     String with an informative message of the event
-     datetime
       -     ISO8601 format
       -     Ex: 2015-07-24T19:01:01+00:00
-     timestamp_desc
       -     String explaining what type of timestamp it is. E.g file created
       -     Ex: "Time created"

title: Timesketch import service (watching files added to a folder) does not work with new ways of importing data.
body:
**Describe the bug**
For those that use the importer service, that uses the script:

https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/master/contrib/timesketch-importer.sh

That does no longer work, since the function 'import', which calls `ImportTimeline()` class in `tsctl` has been deprecated in favor of the new world.

This way of importing data to TS relied on two things,

a) filename did not contain a sketch ID, the data got ingested to Timeline but not associated with any sketch
b) filename did include a sketch ID in the name... the data got ingested and associated to a sketch.

The former use case is no longer supported, and therefore needs to be adjusted there. The latter use case should be supported.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Enable the importer service, using the supplied bash scripts.
2. Copy a file to the folder location that is being monitored by the importer script.
3. Watch the failed imports roll by...

**Expected behavior**
I expected this use case to work.

title: Docker: e2e / dev Sigma directory was not created before
body: There was a glitch in the docker config files that resulted in a Timesketch config not really working as the expected directory was not present

title: User does not have write access controls on sketch with shared public access
body:
**Describe the bug**
Our team discovered the bug when providing access to the team using the share "public - All users of the system can access this sketch". 

We'd identified that the team cannot make comments within the explore tab, which outputted "User does not have write access controls on sketch."

We'd fixed the issue with selecting "private - only you and selected users/group can access this sketch" and selected the user to access the sketch and fixed the access controls in the sketch to make comments.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Click Share and select "public - All users of the system can access this sketch"
2. Login using another user and access the sketch with public access
3.  Go to the explore tab
4.  Click on a message
5. Type a message in the comment and post
6. Returns "User does not have write access controls on sketch"
7. Login back as owner of sketch and go to share tab
8. Select as "private - only you and selected users/group can access this sketch" and choose the access for each user (ideally everyone)
9. Login back as another user
10. Go to sketch with private access
11. Go to Explore
12. Click on any message and type a command and post

**Expected behavior**
User is able to post a comment within the explore tab when owner provides public access to the sketch.

It should not return a "User does not have write access controls on sketch".

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76566157/109312361-f6c95200-7814-11eb-95fe-1fbb2c7d8cfb.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/76566157/109332759-90502e00-782c-11eb-90e9-91ed0f0da850.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 20.04.2 
 - Browser: Chrome

title: Increased timeout value for bulk inserts by default, also made it configurable.
body:
This fixes #1564 

This PR does few things:

1. Fixes a bug in the validation of indices, where a `timeline_id` is set into the list of indices. Since that is done before the conversion of `indices` into actual indices and timelines, it can contain timeline IDs and therefore fail.
2. Add a configuration for the default timeout value for bulk inserts into ES. ATM it's the default behavior of 10 seconds, but a default value of 30 seconds was added.
3. Added the configuration into the `/etc/timesketch.conf` file to configure the timeout value

title: Issue when removing timeline with a shared index
body:
There is an issue when a timeline is removed from a sketch, but the timeline is part of a larger index.

the index cannot be closed unless all timelines in the sketch are also closed.

title: Fixed issues with running analyzers in API client.
body: After the new indexing change a bug got introduced into the API client when attempting to run new analyzers.

title: Aggregation broken in the UI for legacy sketches
body: "legacy" sketches sends the wrong ID (timeline ID instead of index_name) to the aggregation backend.

title: Analyzer history associated with wrong timeline
body:
**Describe the bug**
When I run an Analyzer on one timeline, the progress status (and history) indicate the Analyzer was run on a different timeline. The issue seems to only affect the status window and history. As far as I can tell, the analyzer is actually running on the correct timeline but reported incorrectly.

**To Reproduce**
My test case has six timelines. These are six different .plaso files from six different hosts that were uploaded into Timesketch using the web interface. When I go to the Analyzer tab, select any Analyzer (e.g., phishy domains), and select a timeline (let's say "timeline 6"), and run the Analyzer...the status indicator states the Analyzer is running on "timeline 1". Once the Analyzer is complete, the history is also associated with the incorrect timeline. However, timeline 6 does have tags for "phishy domains", so I believe this is only a cosmetic issue.

**Expected behavior**
I expect that Analyzer status and history to be associated with the timeline I ran the Analyzer against.

**Screenshots**
The screenshot shows the results of when I ran the Analyzer against, DRIVE_2, DRIVE_3, AND DRIVE_4. The analyzer was not run against DRIVE_1. The differing results seem to indicate the analyzer was run against the correct timelines, though.
![timesketch](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70819570/108085383-45236780-7043-11eb-8df8-e60d7b216497.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 Ubuntu 20.04
 Firefox 85.0.1
 *I installed this Timesketch instance on February 11, 2021 using the docker instructions. I understand there are some updates happening, so this may get fixed in the next release. I just wanted to make sure it's on the radar.

title: Set correct timeline for analysis pipeline
body: This PR fixes the build_sketch_analysis_pipeline() function to use provided timeline_id if present. Without this new world timelines will use the index instead and create a pipeline for the whole index instead of the timeline_id

title: UI: Fix missing timeline color
body: This PR adds a v-if on the timeline picker, to wait for the current list of indices to be ready. Otherwise some saved searches will fail to render timeline colors in the picker.

title: Timelines can't be enabled or disabled individually
body:
**Describe the bug**
When I am in the "Explore" view, the timelines show as "badges" in different colors as expected. However, the number of events listed next to each name is the same. I've calculated it, and what I believe it is displaying is the total number of events of all timelines combined. Also, I cannot enable/disable the timelines individually. I can enable all or disable all. When I click the badge of the first timeline I uploaded it enables or disables everything. Clicking on the badges for the other timelines does nothing.

**To Reproduce**
1) Last night I set up a new VM and followed the instructions on the Timesketch Github page.
2) I created a .plaso file of my drive image using log2timeline.
3) I uploaded the .plaso file in Timesketch by creating a new investigation and then "Upload timeline".

**Expected behavior**
My experience using demo.timesketch.org is that timelines can be enabled/disabled in any combination when searching.

**Screenshots**
Attached (with sensitive info covered). If I click the number of events on any badge but the first one, nothing happens. If I click the number of events on the first badge, every timeline is disabled.
![Screenshot 2021-01-30 123147](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/70819570/106363565-3c1e6080-62f7-11eb-95d6-3bbc3c5e9b09.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 20.04
 - Browser: Firefox
 - Version: 84

**Additional context**
Everything else works as expected so far. Thank you!

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'results' referenced before assignment
```
**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:


**Expected behavior**
Read is more long of 10seconds timeout.


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Linux docker install  (us-docker.pkg.dev/osdfir-registry/timesketch/timesketch   latest              f40bb0265ede        8 days ago          564MB)

**Proposed solution**
I found solution work for me. 
At https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/master/timesketch/lib/datastores/elastic.py#L830, change by:
```
- results = self.client.bulk(body=self.import_events)
+ results = self.client.bulk(body=self.import_events, request_timeout=30)
```
I think the param timeout should be in constant value... Maybe close of https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/master/timesketch/lib/datastores/elastic.py#L70 .

Thanks.
Lionel

title: Investigate whether two SearchIndex entries are created for a timeline upload.
body:
**Describe the bug**
It seems like in at least some instances two records for a SearchIndex are generated for each uploaded timeline. Each one of these can then be in different state at any given point in time. One of them has an empty owner, the other one is correctly formed.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Import few timelines, not sure what triggers this ATM
2. Check the database to see that there are two SearchIndex entries for the same search index.

**Expected behavior**
Not that... only one should exist.

title: Clip overflow text in results display

labels.name: Medium effort
labels.description: Stuff that takes between 1d to a week to implement

body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
Long text values (particularly in the Message column) can wrap and go on for a very long time, which makes scrolling through search results difficult. I'd prefer text over a certain length to be clipped, rather than wrapped. 

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Clip text that overflows, rather than wrap. If someone wants to see the whole text, they can click into the row. I personally prefer the see the results more densely, so I can scroll and skim through, looking for something, so the wrapping and making each row take up multiple lines makes the results much more sparse.

title: Bugfix: Handle system generated stories
Remove aggregations and aggregation_groups from API response
body:
We return (but don't use it in the UI) information about saved aggregations and aggregation groups. This can have the side effect to make the response data larger than necessary.

The API client is using this data though so that need to be rewritten to lazy load instead. Assigning too @kiddinn

title: UI: unable to add labels if I'm at the bottom of the screen
body:
**Describe the bug**

In the UI if I'm adding a label (custom) at the bottom of the screen I"m unable to see the "apply" button as well as the labels (if they are many).

You can see how this looks like in the UI:
![Unable to add labels](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8701947/102471065-a7181e80-404c-11eb-8958-808f4b923085.png)

This also applies for other similar pop-up windows, such as in a story, when attempting to add things like aggregations.

![Unable to add aggregation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8701947/102471301-f6f6e580-404c-11eb-95b9-e69abb2afea4.png)

The pop up is cut short so that you cannot add the aggregation/saved search/etc...

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to UI, into explore, search for something, create a label or few, then go to the bottom of the page and attempt to add a label.
2. Be amazed on how it does not work.

**Expected behavior**
I expected the pop-up to be visible and I being able to select the label and to add the aggregation to the story.

**Screenshots**
See above

```
from picatrix import notebook_init
import os

notebook_init.init()

%timesketch_set_active_sketch 1

rootdir = "./single_events_plaso/"

for subdir, dirs, files in os.walk(rootdir):
    for file in files:
        #print os.path.join(subdir, file)
        filepath = subdir + os.sep + file

        if filepath.endswith(".plaso"):

```

- better error handling if it occurs
- or even better, avoid so many uploads to a sketch and give a warning, maybe set an upper limit of 50? 100?

title: Ui Bug: Select aggregations in Stories is not visible
body:
In the Stories module of UI, trying to add an Aggregation when there are multiple, it is not possible to scroll down to the bottom.

Screenshot of it was shared with jbn

title: Fix saved views in stories
body: Event list for saved views are not rendered. Use query string instead of DSL to fix.

title: Pagination fixes
body: This PR changes how we reset pagination. The default is to reset the pagination on all searches, except for when the user clicks the "paginate" buttons.

title: Pagination isn't reset
body: When in pagination mode, and the user changes the filters or query the pagination location is not reset. This leads to confusing UI.

---------------------------------------

For question on ES-QS vs ES-DSL, I thought it was not possible to create a query regex with es-qs (but I was wrong: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-query-string-query.html#_regular_expressions).
Howerver, my query regexp does not work (query: "message:/insta[a-z]{2} zmap/"). When I use the query: "message:/insta[a-z]{2}/", it works, but if you put more than one word then it doesn't work... 
First problem is "https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/cdf0275dc0314e14385797c68a8c774f50be3344/timesketch/lib/analyzers/sigma_tagger.py#L124", you remove .keyword (raw format, no splitted string).

title: fix https://github.com/google/timesketch/issues/1450
body:
Can be tested with:

```
# Try to understand https://github.com/google/timesketch/issues/1450

# connect to TS
from timesketch_api_client import config

ts_client = config.get_client()

ts_client.create_sketch("Demo sketch")

ts_client = config.get_client()
[(x.id, x.name) for x in ts_client.list_sketches()]

sketch = ts_client.get_sketch(1)

from timesketch_import_client import importer


with importer.ImportStreamer() as streamer:
  streamer.set_sketch(sketch)
  streamer.set_timeline_name('test data')
  streamer.set_timestamp_description('some_description')

  streamer.add_file('../test_tools/test_events/sigma_events.jsonl')
from timesketch_import_client import importer


with importer.ImportStreamer() as streamer:
  streamer.set_sketch(sketch)
  streamer.set_timeline_name('test data')
  streamer.set_timestamp_description('some_description')

  streamer.add_file('../test_tools/test_events/sigma_events.jsonl')

#get the correct timeline

[(x.id, x.name) for x in sketch.list_timelines()]

# copy the rule to get it tested
!cp ../data/sigma/rules/lnx_susp_zenmap.yml ../data/sigma/rules/lnx_susp_zenmap2.yml

result = sketch.run_analyzer("Sigma", timeline_id=1)

result2 = sketch.get_analyzer_status() # will give all the ran analyzers, so need to filter
for job in result2:
    if (job['analyzer'] == "Sigma"):
            if (job['timeline_id'] == int(1)):
                                import pprint
                                pp = pprint.PrettyPrinter(indent=4)
                                pp.pprint(job)

# remove the rule at the end again
!rm ../data/sigma/rules/lnx_susp_zenmap2.yml
```

This addresses: https://github.com/google/timesketch/issues/1450
I have not seen any side effects caused by the change.

body:

805588172-[2020-10-29 14:26:09,183] celery.app.trace/ERROR Task timesketch.lib.tasks.run_sketch_analyzer[aaaaa] raised unexpected: TypeError('expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType',)

805588649-    return TaskBase.__call__(self, *args, **kwargs)
805588701-  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/celery/app/trace.py", line 650, in __protected_call__
805588802-    return self.run(*args, **kwargs)

805588945-    sketch_id=sketch_id, index_name=index_name, **kwargs)
805589003:  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/timesketch/lib/analyzers/sigma_tagger.py", line 44, in __init__
805589114:    with open(sigma_config_path, 'r') as sigma_config_file:
805589174-TypeError: expected str, bytes or os.PathLike object, not NoneType
```

If ```sigma_config_path```is none it will fail, so create a check if the ```/etc/timesketch/sigma_config.yaml``` can not be read. This is mostly the case for manual installations, not docker ones that is why it does not occur if docker instance is used.

The end result will be just a yellow traffic light forever.

title: Stripping pagination from saved views.
body:
If you create a view, or a saved search from the UI while not viewing the first page of a result the pagination information is not removed.

This causes the views to fail in the API client (`from` is not known in the query_filter) as well as in stories.

This PR strips the pagination from the `query_filter` before a view is updated or created.

There is also a small fix for updating the index in the story.blocks for the API client.

title: Fix a bug in the API client
body:
Fixing a bug in the API Client.

If `verify=True` is set in the code (which is turned on by default) this is called:
```
session.verify = True
```

However that is not how the API works, SSL certificate verification is turned on by default, and according to the [tools documentation](https://requests.readthedocs.io/en/master/user/advanced/#ssl-cert-verification) it should be:

```
s.verify = '/path/to/certfile'
```

For a specific Certificate file verification. Since this is set to `True` in the code the following errors occurs when using `timesketch` as the authentication mechanism:

```
OSError: Could not find a suitable TLS CA certificate bundle, invalid path: True
```

Also changing how attributes are returned, to make it easier to search for them.

title: Fixes to the API and API client
body:
This PR includes few fixes to the API and API client:

+ Fix a bug in uploads where multiple timelines could be generated, #1422
+ Adding an API to add/remove labels from timelines, #1423
+ Making it a requirement to have write access to a sketch to be able to run an analyzer (since it modifies the data)

title: Adding large sets of data via importer can cause multiple timelines to be created with same data
body:
Uploading large (several 100 k events) sets using the API importer can end in "multiple" timelines.

That created timelines will all have the same name and all the same data in it, so I expect it is not really duplicated in ES but only multiple entries in the TS specific daatabase.

Also if you click one of the Timelines to activate or filter out, all the others are activated / Deactivated.


````
[2020-10-13 13:13:20,033] timesketch.tasks/INFO Index timeline [all_packets.csv] to index [151af5f32cfb447285c4c447403b0c53] (source: jsonl) 
[2020-10-13 13:13:24,278] timesketch.tasks/INFO Index timeline [all_packets.csv] to index [151af5f32cfb447285c4c447403b0c53] (source: jsonl) 
[2020-10-13 13:13:25,892] timesketch.elasticsearch/WARNING Attempting to create an index that already exists (151af5f32cfb447285c4c447403b0c53 - True) 
[2020-10-13 13:13:32,891] celery.worker.strategy/INFO Received task: timesketch.lib.tasks.run_csv_jsonl[bd7d9535-4678-4ecb-9549-caa171e32309]
[2020-10-13 13:14:02,435] timesketch.tasks/INFO Index timeline [all_packets.csv] to index [151af5f32cfb447285c4c447403b0c53] (source: jsonl) 
[2020-10-13 13:14:05,871] timesketch.tasks/INFO Index timeline [all_packets.csv] to index [151af5f32cfb447285c4c447403b0c53]
````

So it seems the script correctly detects that the index already exists.


![gh_import_issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/741037/96725801-954e2e00-13b1-11eb-89c0-7729e556353c.png)

Note: have not verified if it happens also with web uploader.

title: API client: Adding a check for scroll ID in the explore function
body: Small fix when there are few records returned and the query_filter is set there is a chance of an endless loop in the explore function.

title: Missing menus when user has owns no sketch
body:
Tested on branch master:

When the user has no sketch, he does not have access to the "My sketch / Shared with me / Archived".

As soon as he create a sketch, the Tabs appears and he can access to shared sketches.

title: Minor bug fixes
body:
Minor bug fixes:

+ Minor bug fix in stories when the story was generated by the system user (analyzers)
+ Fixing removing groups from ACLs of a sketch
+ Issue with ingesting logs that have special characters in them. Some characters are able to `trick` the CSV library in a way where instead of reading a line as a single line it reads it as multiple "half" lines or partial lines, leaving some lines without a datetime object, and breaking the entire ingestion (single line with a special character could mean no part of the file would get ingested, since the timeline is marked as failed).... this will be replaced by the use of the pandas library soon.

title: Problem with long lines in quotes in stories.
body:
When creating a story and adding a long line in quotes

```
Adding a long line....
```

The UI will show this as editable to begin with

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8701947/93357034-659a8c00-f82f-11ea-8d0d-7bf9eca1912d.png)

But as soon as it gets rendered it will start to look like:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8701947/93357115-7e0aa680-f82f-11ea-81f8-de38adb08ba9.png)

Making it impossible to edit it.  The text field can only be expanded `up and down`, but not to the sides, making it impossible to edit the text.

title: Import csv / jsonl with _id issue
body:
If you import a csv (most likely also jsonl) that has a column:
```_id```

You will get a sketch with zero events without any warnings or hints in celery worker.

This seems to be because the _Id value is used Timesketch internally, so if Timesketch / ES wants to give a new _id, but there is already a value, it breaks.

Expected behaviour:
- ignore that there is already a _id in the to be imported data.

title: Fixing an issue with the export functionality.
body:
If the keyword `from` was added to the query_filter (for pagination) the query export function  fails.

See: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/6.8/breaking-changes-6.0.html#_scroll

```
Scroll
The from parameter can no longer be used in the search request body when initiating a scroll. The parameter was already ignored in these situations, now in addition an error is thrown.
```

Since we want all the events to be exported we are enabling scroll.

title: Pagination is broken if events/page changes
body:
There is a bug when the frontend code doesn't reset the scroll/pagination when you change the number of events to show per page.

Repro: paginate, then change the result/page to be bigger than the result set. This will break the pagination and it get stuck. Also reports the wrong numbers, e.g. 1001-480 / 480

title: Story is missing a chart
body:
Generated a story using an analyzer, using the manual aggregation. Viewing the story in the UI shows the chart as empty, yet both in the API client and in the generated HTML export the chart is clearly visible.

This is how it looks like in the UI:
![story_ui](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8701947/89636056-8c13f180-d897-11ea-938b-6d621eb0895c.png)

But in the exported HTML:
![story_html](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8701947/89636092-9930e080-d897-11ea-8bdd-3ed6a0511096.png)

And in the API client:
![story_api](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8701947/89636111-9f26c180-d897-11ea-9d6a-cac883ff6781.png)

title: CSV exported from Timesketch can not be re-imported (Web importer)
body:
Right now if you export a sketch using **"Overview --> More --> Export"** you get a zip file with (besides other stuff) a csv e.g. starred_events.csv.

As I user I would expect that I can re-import the csv back to Timeskeztch, but I cannot.

I assume this is because the csv contains the columns:
``
tag
_id
_type
_index
``
Which are used from TS.

Imho we should eithe roffer within the CSV a file that can be re-imported or kill those TS internal things from the export.

title: sigma_tagger.py UnicodeDecodeError and other exceptions
body:
Some sigma rules from the sigma upstream project are causing Exceptions like:

```Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/src/timesketch/timesketch/lib/analyzers/interface.py", line 804, in run_wrapper result = self.run() File "/usr/local/src/timesketch/timesketch/lib/analyzers/sigma_tagger.py", line 105, in run rule_file_content = rule_file.read() File "/usr/lib/python3.6/encodings/ascii.py", line 26, in decode return codecs.ascii_decode(input, self.errors)[0] UnicodeDecodeError: 'ascii' codec can't decode byte 0xc3 in position 214: ordinal not in range(128)```

IN the past, there was an except block to catch all of them and not cause it to stop:
https://github.com/jaegeral/timesketch/blob/c926b3889b0eafdc6a060a51c05d8446a766cc3d/timesketch/lib/analyzers/sigma_tagger.py#L114

This was however not really elegant and is problematic as it would only occur for analysts running analyzers, which not all have access to the logs of Timesketch, so they would not know why it did not work.

Three possible ways to address that:
a) re-introduce the broad except
b) write a small tool that checks all rules that can be used by an admin when rules are added
c) fix the problem upstream

or: do nothing.

title: Bug: Count per timeline is multiplied by number of shards
body: The count total is for all shards for the index. This results in the wrong count for indices with more than 1 shard allocated.

title: ES too_long_frame_exception if a sketch contains many timelines?
body:
We get a `RequestError(400, 'too_long_frame_exception', 'An HTTP line is larger than 4096 bytes.')` starting at this line.

https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/4d1fba42836a33a0cb09028c135e6b132fa71421/timesketch/api/v1/resources.py#L435

Increasing `http.max_initial_line_length` (its [default](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/modules-http.html) is 4kb) would probably fix this though - but our ES provider does not allow changing this value.

We have 205 timelines associated to the given sketch.

Has anyone else seen this error? If our explanation above is correct, it might make sense to limit the maximal amount of timelines per sketch, what do you think?

title: The database can contain more than one entry for each search index name
body:
It seems as there is a condition that can cause more than one entry created for `SearchIndex` model in the database for each ES search index.

It seems as there are two, one in the state of `ready` and one in the state of `processing`. the one in the `ready` state can be added to a Timeline, while the other one sits there.

This causes listing search indexes to display double entries, and can cause concerns when deleting search indexes.

title: Various changes to tsctl and the API
body:
This changes few things:

1. Adds version information to tsctl, #1268
2. Adds version information to the API and adds a query to the API client to look up the backend version.
3. Adding status check to `tsctl list_sketches`, #1269
4. Adding a `description` property to the index API client object.
5. Adding some error handling into the API for fetching sketch to deal with potentially missing searchindexes in timelines
6. Adding some error handling into the `add_index` option in tsctl, see #1270
7. Changes to how searchindexes are deleted in the API 
8. Some other error handling or checks added to the API.
