title: Refactor, adding version info and minor bug fixes
body:
Few things done in this PR

1. Updating the version information for numpy/pandas/altair to match a more recent version (also to cut time on compiling needed for ubuntu 20.04
2. **bug fix** ExploreResource now checks whether an index is in a `ready` state before it is added to the search, so if `_all` is used as an index, timelines in an error state or other states are not included in the search
3. **bug fix** A new error condition is handled in `utils.py` where an attempt is made to create an index that already exists (in the case where an importer is importing a file in chunks)
4. Timesketch version information is moved out of setup.py into a separate file
5. The Timesketch Version information is now included in the metadata of a sketch export.
6. When a timeline is added to a sketch all sketch labels that are deemed "protected" are propagated to the timeline and search index (to prevent deletion)
7. Various bug fixes in the API client and resources to deal with handling an archived sketch.
8. Changing the way sketches are archived to be a status instead of a label

title: Minor bug fixes in the sketch API client library.
body: Fixing a bug in the `create_sketch` function as well as clarifying the parameters to the `explore` function.

title: docker-compose fails (setuptools module missing)
body:
Following the instructions on installing timesketch via docker-compose

`ubuntu@tfsa:~/timesketch/docker$ docker-compose up`

...ends up with this error:

```
[...]
Setting up plaso-tools (20200430-1ppa1~bionic) ...
Processing triggers for libc-bin (2.27-3ubuntu1) ...
Removing intermediate container dda12f0ee07c
 ---> cb515e91238d
Step 7/17 : RUN pip3 install timesketch
 ---> Running in a97cb6808c1b
Collecting timesketch
  Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/ed/00/4fd5de4724b90719cf7777e19f5144bd6fa040333b382ced2d8ef4785d24/timesketch-20200507.tar.gz (8.9MB)
    Complete output from command python setup.py egg_info:
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
    ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'setuptools'

    ----------------------------------------
Command "python setup.py egg_info" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-build-ophpati2/timesketch/
ERROR: Service 'timesketch' failed to build: The command '/bin/sh -c pip3 install timesketch' returned a non-zero code: 1
```

The fix is trivial:
```
--- timesketch/docker/Dockerfile.orig	2020-05-13 07:38:16.231279535 +0000
+++ timesketch/docker/Dockerfile	2020-05-13 07:47:25.105866242 +0000
@@ -13,7 +13,9 @@
                        lsb-release \
                        python3-dev \
                        python3-pip \
-                       python3-psycopg2
+                       python3-psycopg2 \
+                       python3-setuptools \
+                       python3-wheel

 # Install Plaso, nodejs and yarn.
 RUN apt-get --no-install-recommends -y install software-properties-common
```

title: Minor changes to importer and api
body: Minor changes, small bug fixes in the importer as well as a slightly different method of getting to the form data in the resource API

title: Bugfix: Pagination and event count
body: If using ES 7.x, the event count and pagination is broken as it will always show 0 result. This PR fixes that.

title: Fix an issue with the importer
body:
This PR does few things:

+ Increment the version of the API client
+ Reduce the entry threshold from 100k to 50k
+ Add a sleep command to fix issues with a race condition with post requests
+ Fix an issue with threshold setting
+ Add the option to define threshold in the importer tool
+ Adding a try/except around bulk inserts into ES, handling timeout issues.

title: Soft Fail on File import due to character encoding issues
body:
When importing certain files with non utf-8 character encodings, or when there is some issues with encoding TS will fail entirely to import the file.

A better behavior would be to soft fail, that is to replace characters it is unable to understand with ? or something like that and import the rest, instead of entirely failing the import.

This can be added into the importer, to have it being more error proofed.

title: Setup.py fails to build
body:
Using:
```
$ pip --version
pip 20.0.2 from ....
```

I can no longer use setup.py to build the tool:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 30, in <module>
    from pip._internal.download import PipSession
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'pip._internal.download'

During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "setup.py", line 33, in <module>
    from pip.download import PipSession
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'pip.download'

```

Looking at the pypi documentation I see: https://pip.pypa.io/en/stable/user_guide/#using-pip-from-your-program

More specifically:
```
pip is a command line program. While it is implemented in Python, and so is available from your Python code via import pip, you must not use pip’s internal APIs in this way
```

The supported way of using it is:
```
subprocess.check_call([sys.executable, '-m', 'pip', 'install', 'my_package'])
```

title: Bug fix: Trailing slash in API urls
body: When run behind a proxy the trailing slash is important so to not redirect to HTTP.

title: Context query timestamps cannot be deleted
body: The (x) button next to the timestamps does not work

title: Sorting order dropdown shows duplicates
body: The sorting order dropdown shows both the selected order as well asc/desc resulting in duplicates.

title: Set correct value in option dropdown
body: Fixes empty dropdown

title: Bugfix: Do not strip domain when changing ACL
New UI: Bugfix for sharing form
body: Fixes a bug in the sharing form

title: Small bugfix for word wraps
body: Fixes uneven columns

title: Bugfix for views without fields
body:
* Fix for when there are no field selected.
* Fix for overflow in eventlist table

title: Fix views in story mode
body: A bug creeped in, making view not render in stories. This PR fixes that.

title: New UI: Just show delete menu if user has permission
Fixing bug in listing stored aggregators
body: Fixing #1014 , where listing and fetching stored aggregations didn't work.

title: Fixing #1017 and one other minor issue.
body: Adding a fix to #1017, if you attempt to upload a file and the TS backend is still running py2 then you'll have an exception raised. So adding backward compatibility there as well as fixing a minor issue in the importer.

title: Bug in the importer (py3 vs py2)
body:
When importing a file, came across:

```
  File "...ib/python2.7/site-packages/timesketch/lib/tasks.py", line 467, in run_csv_jsonl
    for event in read_and_validate(source_file_path):
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/timesketch/lib/utils.py", line 66, in read_and_validate_csv
    with open(path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as fh:
TypeError: 'encoding' is an invalid keyword argument for this function
```

This is an issue when run on py2 (open there doesn't support encoding option)

Solution to use io.open instead of open

Another issue that has come up is:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "...lib/python2.7/site-packages/timesketch/lib/tasks.py", line 467, in run_csv_jsonl
    for event in read_and_validate(source_file_path):
  File ".../lib/python2.7/site-packages/timesketch/lib/utils.py", line 81, in read_and_validate_csv
    for row in reader:
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/csv.py", line 108, in next
    row = self.reader.next()
UnicodeEncodeError: 'ascii' codec can't encode character u'\u2019' in position 92: ordinal not in range(128)
```

This is another py2 issue

title: List stored aggregations no longer works.
body:
Looking at: https://github.com/google/timesketch/commit/cae44e33349042f7188d6c9ad840365d9fd89cd4#diff-3053e4f8736b32979fd112ea31169e2a 

This is from #1003 , which changed how the saved aggregations are stored in the sketch object from the API.

This has resulted in stored aggregations no longer showing up...

There is a fix in #1004 to add more error handling, to make the `list_aggregations()` function not throw an error, however it is not reading from the datastore.

Calling `store_aggregation` does work, it saves the aggregation into the datastore, see:
```
timesketch=# select * from aggregation;
 id |         created_at         |         updated_at         |       name        | description |   agg_type   |            parameters            | chart_type | user_id | sketch_id | view_id
----+----------------------------+----------------------------+-------------------+-------------+--------------+----------------------------------+------------+---------+-----------+---------
  1 | 2019-10-28 15:42:31.544436 | 2019-10-28 15:42:31.544436 | first_aggregation | so exciting | field_bucket | {"field": "domain", "limit": 10} |            |         |         1 |
  2 | 2019-10-28 15:43:16.277782 | 2019-10-28 15:43:16.277782 | first_aggregation | so exciting | field_bucket | {"field": "domain", "limit": 10} |            |         |         1 |
  3 | 2019-10-28 15:56:36.915083 | 2019-10-28 15:56:36.915083 | first_aggregation | so exciting | field_bucket | {"field": "domain", "limit": 10} |            |         |         1 |
```

However the aggregation fields are not in the returned object from `lazyload_data`, irrelevant wether an aggregation is stored in a sketch or not.

title: Minor client changes
body:
Fixing issue #957 

+ Adding a get_view
+ Fixing a doc string issue
+ When you define return_fields and build a pandas DataFrame then you don't include default fields
+ Adding pandas support to search by labels

title: Minor bug in client.
Fixing aggregations in the API client
body:
Removing the need to depend on the aggregation manager, and thus removing dependencies on timesketch library in the API client.

Also adding support for storing and listing stored aggregations.

title: Graph queries all come back blank
body: Running Timesketch in Docker, `aorlikoski/skadi_timesketch:20190326`, zero issues with anything, except Graph. Graph feature is enabled in timesketch.conf. We imported about 90 million events and a dozen timelines. We tried running Graph queries, and it consistently comes back blank. No errors, docker logs show 200's and lots of `POST /api/v1/sketches/1/event/annotate/ => generated 169 bytes in 44 msecs (HTTP/1.1 201) 3 headers in 91 bytes (1 switches on core 0)` But graphs are consistently blank. The only errors I see are in the developer console in the browser. Any help is appreciated. I sincerely hope it's something dumb that I did on my end. Thank you.

title: Fixing an issue with domain analyzer.
body: There was a bug in domain analyzer whereas if the domain counter was empty it would raise an exception when calculating the 20th/85th percentiles.

title: Searching within starred events does not work
body:
Hello,

using our current setup, search queries in combination with starred events `__ts_star` (as workaround described in #180) do not work any more. In prior releases this was possible (unintentionally or not). The "normal" view of starred events works as expected.

We use the latest Timesketch release [20190207](https://github.com/google/timesketch/releases/tag/20190207) in combination with Plaso [plaso-20190331](https://github.com/log2timeline/plaso/releases/tag/20190331).

Is there a way to get this fixed or another solution?
Thank you!

title: Can't view data generated by Plaso versions later than 20180930 in Timesketch
body:
**Issue**
When attempting to view a timeline in Timesketch, any Plaso files generated by Plaso versions later than 20180930 fail to show and result in the following error being generated by Timesketch:

`[2019-06-10 13:32:45,674] ERROR in app: Exception on /api/v1/sketches/1/explore/ [POST]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 1813, in full_dispatch_request
    rv = self.dispatch_request()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/app.py", line 1799, in dispatch_request
    return self.view_functions[rule.endpoint](**req.view_args)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask_restful/__init__.py", line 480, in wrapper
    resp = resource(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask/views.py", line 88, in view
    return self.dispatch_request(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask_restful/__init__.py", line 595, in dispatch_request
    resp = meth(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/flask_login/utils.py", line 228, in decorated_view
    return func(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/timesketch/api/v1/resources.py", line 692, in post
    enable_scroll=enable_scroll)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/timesketch/lib/datastores/elastic.py", line 317, in search
    scroll=scroll_timeout)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/elasticsearch/client/utils.py", line 73, in _wrapped
    return func(*args, params=params, **kwargs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/elasticsearch/client/__init__.py", line 623, in search
    doc_type, '_search'), params=params, body=body)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/elasticsearch/transport.py", line 312, in perform_request
    status, headers, data = connection.perform_request(method, url, params, body, ignore=ignore, timeout=timeout)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/elasticsearch/connection/http_urllib3.py", line 128, in perform_request
    self._raise_error(response.status, raw_data)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/elasticsearch/connection/base.py", line 125, in _raise_error
    raise HTTP_EXCEPTIONS.get(status_code, TransportError)(status_code, error_message, additional_info)
elasticsearch.exceptions.RequestError: TransportError(400, 'search_phase_execution_exception', 'No mapping found for [datetime] in order to sort on')`

**Steps to reproduce**
1. Create a Plaso file using a version of log2timeline later than 20180930.
2. Start a new instance of Timesketch (current version on Github) in Docker.
3. Within the Timesketch Docker container, execute psort.py with output set to "timesketch" to import Plaso file.
4. Import will finish successfully, but attempting to view the timeline within Timesketch generates the above error.

I've checked this behavior and it is consistent when importing Plaso files from different systems. I have example working/non-working Plaso files if these would be useful.

`from neo4jrestclient.client import GraphDatabase

Is there a quick fix for it? Also when connecting to the Neo4J Browser, is see an empty database only.

title: OutOfBoundsDatetime Exception when returning Pandas df via API
body:
This occurs when using the API to return a Pandas df, when the results have a pre 1970-01-01 timestamp (1601-01-01T00:00:00+00:00 is probably most common problem time). 

Example query on demo server:
```
active_sketch = sketches[0]
active_sketch.explore(query_string='bepbmhgboaologfdajaanbcjmnhjmhfn', as_pandas=True)

> ...
> OutOfBoundsDatetime: Out of bounds nanosecond timestamp: 1601-01-01 00:00:00
```

I think that pandas.to_datetime() can't handle dates that early (or webkit dates at all?).

title: "Next" button behavior is confusing when a search limit is hit
body: When a search returns lots of events, a limit is hit on the number of results return. Hitting "Next" to page through gets to the end of the list of these events, but doesn't re-run the query, so it's not possible to page through all results.

title: Changed domain analyzer, removing human readable manipulation, issue #847
body: Instead of changing the human readable string to include the domain count, only add a tag for the top 85th percentile and the rare occurrences of domains, otherwise leave the human readable field "alone".

title: Only create saved view if there are hits
body: Don't create saved view of there are 0 events tagged.

title: Upgrade urllib3 due to security fix
body: Fixes recent security issue in urllib3

title: Run index analyzers in a chain
body: As with sketch analyzers, running the index analyzers in parallel can be problamatic if operations on the same index happens from multiple workers. This PR changes that to run one analyzer per index at a time.

title: add_view in analyzers interface needs to be modified to prevent duplicates
body:
If an analyzer adds a view and it is run on more than a single timeline, it will create multiple views that are the exact copy of one another.

The add_view function in the analyzer interface needs to be changed so that it first checks to see if the view has already been added before it is added to the sketch.

title: Change the set_human_readable function in analyzers interface
body:
The issue is that if there are more than one analyzer that changes the human_readable string for the same data, it will only reflect the last human readable string written, creating a race condition between analyzers.

Instead have the function check if it already exists and append or prepend to the string.
 + Some analyzers may include the original message in the string as well, can we have a way to make sure that does not get repeated?

title: Don't remove session when engine is created
body:
the way Flask operates has changed in regards to how database engines and sessions are handled. In our DB engine code there is a session.close() call that can lead to detached state in some circumstances.

Fixes:  #711

title: Overwrite size value for exported events.
body: This fixes #686 by overwriting the size value on query_filter to 10k

body: Some bugs found when testing the new l2t_scaffolder.

title: Bug: Pagination is not updated when filter out events
body:
Having a list of events in a sketch, after filtering out one or more events, the events per page ar not updated.

### Work environment

| Questions                     | Answers
|-------------------------------|--------------------
| Type of issue                 | Bug

### Expected behavior

After filtering out the event, the first event from the next page should be seen on the current page
So the number of displayed should always be the number selected per page, not less.

### Actual behavior

Pagination is not updated, resulting in worst case in a complete empty page.
So number of diplayed elements is < number of elements per page selected

### Steps to reproduce the behavior
Get a list of events, filter out one and see the result

### Logs, screenshots, configuration dump, ...

![pagination error](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/741037/48555077-6a632180-e8e0-11e8-85dd-a83be08272b0.png)


Not sure if it is related to: https://github.com/google/timesketch/issues/621

title: uploaded files are in an endless loop
body:
Uploading a file via API or web ui can cause an endless loop trying to import the file but without any visible progress.

After asking in Slack, @berggren pointed me to look at the celery worker logs at /var/log/celery

The version I used was the latest HEAD version from github within a vagrant instance.

My logs looked like: 

````
[2018-11-07 18:59:33,846: INFO/MainProcess] Connected to redis://127.0.0.1:6379//
[2018-11-07 18:59:33,864: INFO/MainProcess] mingle: searching for neighbors
[2018-11-07 18:59:34,882: INFO/MainProcess] mingle: all alone
[2018-11-07 18:59:34,900: INFO/MainProcess] w1@timesketch-dev ready.
[2018-11-07 19:14:26,621: INFO/MainProcess] Connected to redis://127.0.0.1:6379//
[2018-11-07 19:14:26,631: INFO/MainProcess] mingle: searching for neighbors
[2018-11-07 19:14:27,652: INFO/MainProcess] mingle: all alone
[2018-11-07 19:14:27,657: INFO/MainProcess] w1@timesketch-dev ready.

````

So something was wrong, there where no jobs visible.
After searching in the timesketch github repo I found the following command to start the workers:

````
bash -c "/usr/local/bin/celery -A timesketch.lib.tasks worker --uid nobody --loglevel info"

````

Then I got the workers running and new jobs appeared as planned:

````
[2018-11-09 18:41:42,905: INFO/ForkPoolWorker-2] Task timesketch.lib.tasks.run_csv_jsonl[3618ed49-d28b-402c-ac01-e48ba3282458] succeeded in 0.248744058999s: None
[2018-11-09 18:41:48,311: INFO/ForkPoolWorker-2] Index timeline [sample] to index [1765c1fb5ce54e1b9d24b3a771486f1a] (source: csv)
[2018-11-09 18:41:48,462: INFO/ForkPoolWorker-2] Task timesketch.lib.tasks.run_csv_jsonl[428c3759-30ff-4e7d-a9a8-950f57e5fa83] succeeded in 0.151471524001s: '1765c1fb5ce54e1b9d24b3a771486f1a'
[2018-11-07 18:59:33,846: INFO/MainProcess] Connected to redis://127.0.0.1:6379//
[2018-11-07 18:59:33,864: INFO/MainProcess] mingle: searching for neighbors
[2018-11-07 18:59:34,882: INFO/MainProcess] mingle: all alone
[2018-11-07 18:59:34,900: INFO/MainProcess] w1@timesketch-dev ready.
[2018-11-07 19:14:26,621: INFO/MainProcess] Connected to redis://127.0.0.1:6379//
[2018-11-07 19:14:26,631: INFO/MainProcess] mingle: searching for neighbors
[2018-11-07 19:14:27,652: INFO/MainProcess] mingle: all alone
[2018-11-07 19:14:27,657: INFO/MainProcess] w1@timesketch-dev ready.
[2018-11-09 18:36:57,792: INFO/MainProcess] sync with celery@timesketch-dev
[2018-11-09 18:39:30,985: INFO/MainProcess] sync with celery@timesketch-dev
[2018-11-09 18:41:32,188: INFO/MainProcess] sync with celery@timesketch-dev
[2018-11-09 18:41:42,655: INFO/MainProcess] Received task: timesketch.lib.tasks.run_csv_jsonl[3618ed49-d28b-402c-ac01-e48ba3282458]  
[2018-11-09 18:41:48,310: INFO/MainProcess] Received task: timesketch.lib.tasks.run_csv_jsonl[428c3759-30ff-4e7d-a9a8-950f57e5fa83]  

````

So Imho there should be two tasks now:

- [ ] Fix it in sourcecode to monitor the status of the workers and kind of userfeedback why nothing happens
- [ ] Add it to troubleshooting guide where to look if something is wrong

You have push new code on #656 with dependency on pyyaml. You add in required "pyyaml==3.13" but pyyaml is already installed by unbuntu packaging (deb required by plaso and other package). When i install timesktech by docker, pip try to install version 3.13, error "Cannot uninstall 'PyYAML'. It is a distutils installed project and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong to it which would lead to only a partial uninstall." is indicated. Why you add dependency because i dont found in code where you use it...
Thanks for fix it and thanks for you project!
Sincerly, LIonel

title: Elasticsearch 6.x support

Support both Elasticsearch 5.x and 6.x. Deprecate groovy scripts and replace with Painless scripts.
Minor changes to aggregations as well and how line charts are displayed and scaled.

Fixes: #575

title: Internal server error hen adding manual events
body: If you add a manual event and forget to provide a timestamp description, the UI gives back an internal server error, should be a more accurate error message IMHO.

title: Events not displayed - possible pagination issue
body:
Using Timesketch recently I had two odd occurrences:

1. Paging through a large number of events, page 17 loaded with no events. Moving forward to page 18, events were displayed, then going back to page 17 the events I expected to see were there.
1. No results were displayed at all for some searches, despite the event counter showing a number of results returned from the query. 

I can provide more information privately.

The selector cannot be opened as clicking on it highlight the whole select widget instead of opening it.

title: CSV Upload "Missing fields in CSV header: [u'message']"
body:
Pulled the latest version of timesketch today in a vagrant, ran it, tried to upload a csv which looks like the following:
```
message,timestamp,datetime,timestamp_desc,Date,aaa
A message,1331698658276340,2015-07-24T19:01:01+00:00,Write time,foo,baraaaa
```

Gives me the following error:
`
                        Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/usr/local/src/timesketch/timesketch/lib/tasks.py", line 143, in run_csv_jsonl
    for event in read_and_validate(source_file_path, delimiter):
  File "/usr/local/src/timesketch/timesketch/lib/utils.py", line 61, in read_and_validate_csv
    u'Missing fields in CSV header: {0:s}'.format(missing_fields))
RuntimeError: Missing fields in CSV header: [u'message']
`

However, as far as I can tell, the header is set in the right way.

I stumbled across the error while trying to import a way larger csv with way more columns that failed for some reason and trying to shrink the file down I ended up with the mentioned bug above.

Ideally a preview of the csv would be handy to see what was parsed or what was the error.

title: Show all active timelines

body:
This PR changes how we do aggregations. It uses nested aggregations instead of computing all buckets server side, making it faster and less memory hungry.

Also some dafe guards in place to not render and calculate charts when there are many (>300k) events in the result.

title: ES datastore fails to import events if text within an event is a ceratin type
body:
The [deocoding](https://github.com/google/timesketch/blob/master/timesketch/lib/datastores/elastic.py#L390) within `import_event()` for the ES datastore doesn't handle embedded lists/dicts etc. as a value in `event`.  This may be by design but figured I'd bring it up as some timelines I have are configured this way and failed to upload in recent TS versions as a result.

If it's not by design, it'd be trivial to automatically check the value's type and iterate if it's not a str or int and then decode.

Traceback:
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
...
  File "tsctl", line 319, in run
    flush_interval, index_name, event_type, event)
  File ".../timesketch/timesketch/lib/datastores/elastic.py", line 390, in import_event
    k.decode(u'utf8'): v.decode(u'utf8') for k, v in event.items()
  File ".../timesketch/timesketch/lib/datastores/elastic.py", line 390, in <dictcomp>
    k.decode(u'utf8'): v.decode(u'utf8') for k, v in event.items()
AttributeError: 'list' object has no attribute 'decode'
```

Change all imports of current_app to import from flask instead of

Timesketch stuff that relied on it (#243). Also updating forms to use

been re-named and is apparently going away soonish.

q=foo&index=foobar&limit=10

title: Surface XSRF token errors
body:
There is no visible error when there are XSRF token errors from hiding/starring events, and the UI still seems to perform actions as if there were no problems.  It's not until you try an action that actually switches the page that you see the warning message about invalid tokens, and then coming back you can see all the work you've done on the timeline in the meantime was lost.

This can happen if you load a page, leave and come back a while later (not sure how long the tokens are good for, but it's happened to me twice now) and start working on the timeline without re-loading the page.

Maybe an easy shorter term workaround would be to pop up a message to re-load the page if it's been idle for too long.  Or maybe there's a way to refresh the tokens every once in a while?

body:
When filling timesketch with 
tsctl csv2ts --name name --index name --file file.csv
or
tsctl json2ts --name name --index name --file file.json

Timesketch needs some fields to be present at json/csv file to parse data correctly and correctly push them to elasticsearch. If datetime field is absent, above commands will succesfully finish and add bad mapping in elasticsearch. It causes not very informative error at every use of search. 
Please add test for input data format.

psort.py -q -o pstorage -w testing.plaso --slice "2015-01-08 09:47:16" --slice_size 100 timeline.plaso

title: Timeline picker bug
body:
There is a race condition on how the timeline picker gets rendered in the UI. In some cases the View XHR request returns to the client before the Sketch XHR request, making the list of selected timelines to reset to all selected.

This change will not fetch the view before the sketch XHR is done, as intended.

Ref issue: #150 
Reviewer: @onager

title: Timeline picker bug
body: There is a race condition on how the timeline picker gets rendered in the UI. In some cases the View XHR request returns to the client before the Sketch XHR request, making the list of selected timelines to reset to all selected.

title: Hide Psort tasks that have timed out
body:
When a psort celery task get interupted, or get stuck in PENDING state it will never be removed from the home page queue card.

Only show tasks that are being processed and have not timed out.

title: ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS
body:
Can't login because of too many redirects.
This is caused by a breaking change in flask-login where is_authenticated is now a method.

title: 111 data location for frontend
body:
This PR enables message string support in the Plaso frontend task.
Resolves: #111 
Reviewer: @onager

title: is_authenticated() is not working
body: flask-login (>= 0.3.0) did a breaking change: The `is_authenticated`, `is_active`, and `is_anonymous` members of the user class are now properties, not methods.

This fixes #89

title: Importing of JSON timelines creates duplicate timelines with same name.
body:
Steps to reproduce
1) command line:
echo '[
  {
    "datetime": "2012-04-12T17:24:38-08:00",
    "timestamp_desc": "Test",
    "timestamp": 1334251478000000,
    "message": "Test message"
  }
]' > test_dupe.json  
tsctl json2ts --name test_dupe --file test_dupe.json
tsctl json2ts --name test_dupe --file test_dupe.json

2) Create new sketch
3) Notice duplicate "test_dupe" timelines on list to select from.
4) Add both
5) Explore, using "*" as filter.
6) notice duplicate results.

title: Sort timelines in timelines view
body: - The default list of timelines should be sorted by last added, both in the initial view and in search results.

title: Fix datetime string output to address firefox issue
body:
This resolves issue #34

For some reason Tastypie (the REST API framework we are using) returns datetime like "2014-11-12 22:23:26". This makes some implementations of the Date() javascript function sad, e.g. Firefox which results in dates not displayed when fetched via the API. One example is event comments.

This CL makes the serialiser output the following format instead, which makes everyone happy:
2014-11-12T22:23:26+0000

(We are loosing some precision here, but that doesn't really matters because this is only used in some UI elements where second precision is just fine)

Note: The API code is due to refactoring and clean up. This will be done in a later CL (tracked in #9).
https://gist.github.com/berggren/3888c6ebb128f6adc63d

Reviewer: @joachimmetz

title: Javascript Date format incompatible with Firefox
